item.title: Preschool Storytime
item.description: Preschoolers enjoy a variety of stories, songs, fingerplays, action rhymes, and other activities aimed at building a love of language, books, and reading.
item.otherinfo: Children attend this storytime without parents and must be at least three years old by September 16. This is a drop-in program; no registration required.

item.title: Meet with CJE Senior Life
item.description: Do you have questions about retirement and health insurance options? Are you facing a life-changing decision or are you concerned about long-term supports? Resource specialists from CJE SeniorLife provide counseling to adults age 60 and older and their families and caregivers. Counseling includes selection of appropriate retirement benefits, picking the right health insurance and Medicare programs, determining housing needs, identifying supportive resources, and much more.
item.otherinfo: CJE Representative available is fluent in Russian.

item.title: Talking Books Discussion Group
item.description: People with visual impairments are invited to take part in this monthly Talking Books program. Library staff mail the Talking Books cassettes from the Library of Congress to everyone signed up for the discussion.

item.title: Advanced Photoshop Elements
item.description: Take your Photoshop Elements skills to the next level. In this advanced class, learn to enhance your digital photos using layers, cloning, and content aware fill. Sample images can be provided, but you are highly encouraged to bring your own photos to work with. It is recommended that you take the beginner Photoshop Elements class before registering for this class. Class is hands-on, taught on Apple computers.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Minecraft Mania
item.description: Minecraft is the game everyone is playing. Let's get together, punch some dirt, and explore a world without limits. No account? No problem--use one of ours. Class size is limited.
item.otherinfo: For grades 6-8. Registration begins October 1.

item.title: ESL Cafe
item.description: If you are new to English or just want to practice talking in a relaxed space, drop in for conversation with members of the community. Teachers from the ORT Institute will be facilitating conversations.

item.title: You Can't Google This
item.description: Learn to find information that "you can't Google," including learning a language online, getting a diagram to help repair your car, finding a recipe that was in the Chicago Tribune years ago, reading today’s newspapers from around the country or the world, taking practice exams, uncovering documents to fill in your family tree, getting lists of foreclosed properties, obtaining sample business plans, and more. Class is lecture-based.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Pajama Storytime
item.description: Children ages 2 to 7 and their caregivers are invited to join us under the library stars for our favorite stories. Pajamas are optional, but fun is mandatory!
item.otherinfo: This is a drop-in program; no registration is required.

item.title: iPad – Fun Stuff
item.description: Learn to set up your email account in the Mail app and how to manage photos in this hands-on class. We’ll also review how to copy/paste text and pictures and how to bookmark your favorite websites. Basic iPad knowledge is necessary. Bring your own iPad or use one of ours.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Death Café Cancelled
item.description: This program has been cancelled due to low registration.
item.otherinfo: This program has been cancelled due to low registration.

item.title: Math Club
item.description: Celebrate the fun and intricate world of mathematics. We'll be exploring geometry in three dimensions!
item.otherinfo: For grades 3-6. Registration is required and begins October 1.

item.title: Make Movies
item.description: Learn to make a professional-looking movie using Apple iMovie. Topics include importing footage, editing content, adding special effects, and transferring to DVD. Classes are taught on Apple computers.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Intermediate Microsoft Word 2010
item.description: Learn to create headers and footers, adjust margins, download and use templates, add nontext objects (clip art, photographs, watermarks), apply Quick Styles, and more. It is recommended that you take the Beginner Microsoft Word 2010 class before registering for this hands-on class.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required. If you attend any three Microsoft Office classes you will receive a Skokie Public Library Certificate of Learning for Microsoft Office 2010.

item.title: Block Party!
item.description: Attention all builders ages 3 to 5: if you like making roads, bridges, castles, towers, and skyscrapers, drop in each Friday morning, and try out our brand new set of blocks. We can't wait to see what you create!
item.otherinfo: No registration is required.

item.title: Toddler Time for Twos
item.description: Toddlers and their grown-ups share a lively program of simple stories, songs, games, and fingerplays.
item.otherinfo: Children must be two years old by September 19 and attend with a parent or adult caregiver. This is a drop-in program; no registration required.

item.title: Words and Pictures
item.description:
Released: 2014
Prep school teachers Dina and Jack flirt and provoke each other with equal relish. Dina teaches art, but her ability to paint is hampered by rheumatoid arthritis. Jack teaches English, but his livelihood is threatened by alcoholism. As they butt heads over which is superior - pictures or words - they find their mutual attraction hard to ignore. Starring Clive Owen and Juliette Binoche.
Running Time: 111 minutes
Rated: PG-13 for sexual material including nude sketches, languages, and some mature thematic content
Genre: Romantic Comedy

item.title: LIttle Learners Storytime
item.description: Read ~ Experiment ~ Grow! Help your child along the road to reading each week with stories and fun hands-on literacy, math, and science activities.
item.otherinfo: For ages 4-5. Children must be accompanied by a parent or adult caregiver. Registration begins September 2.

item.title: Spooky Stories on the Village Green
item.description: If you are brave enough to weather spooktacular stories told by renowned storyteller, Vlada Bernhardtz, you will be rewarded with a marshmallow roast. Please bring a blanket to sit on.
item.otherinfo: If it rains, this drop-in program will move indoors.

item.title: Humans vs. Zombies
item.description: Join us for a rousing game of Humans vs. Zombies on the Village Green. Between rounds of this dash and blast game, we will also be doing zombie makeup and filming a horror short in the library. Everyone knows library patrons have the best BRAAAAAAAINS! Get your gruesome on!

item.title: Community Conversation
item.description: Through open dialogue and guided by specific questions, participants in each of three guided conversation groups will have the opportunity to share their aspirations and goals for the community of Skokie. Some of the knowledge gained from this conversation may inform a new Library program, service, or partnership. Knowledge gained may also be shared with appropriate community organizations for them to address.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required. For more information call to speak with our Community Engagement department.

item.title: Elements Contemporary Ballet Previews 'The Sun King'
item.description: Elements will break ground in 2014 with The Sun King, a world-premiere contemporary ballet inspired by the the life of French monarch Louis XIV and his famed court composer Jean-Baptiste Lully. Dramatic storytelling and lush costumes will combine with cutting-edge contemporary dance in a preview of this truly unique production.

item.title: Baby Signs: Family Sign, Say, and Play
item.description: Learn sign language in this introductory session featuring mealtime signs and other signs beneficial to getting started with sign language. Each week will feature different signs.
item.date2: 201410271030Baby Signs: Family Sign, Say, and Play
item.otherinfo: For birth through grade 5. No registration is required. Siblings welcome.
item.presenter: Jamie Stevens, certified Baby Signs instructor

item.title: Lego Club
item.description: Kids are invited to drop in and build with our vast collection of Legos. Work on your own or help build a joint Lego masterpiece. Duplos will be on hand for little ones.
item.otherinfo: Children younger than 8 years must be accompanied by an adult. No registration required.

item.title: Illinois Student Assistance Commision
item.description: Drop in to learn all about your options for financial aid. Representatives of the Illinois Student Assistance Commission will help with your FAFSA and help you find out about other ways to get money for school. Altavoces españoles dan la bienvenida.

item.title: Write On! A Skokie Writers Group
item.description: Local aspiring and published authors looking to perfect their skills are invited to gather and workshop their writing. Adult and teen, novice and experienced, writers are welcome.
item.otherinfo: Please bring a writing selection that you would like to workshop.

item.title: Cracking the [HTML] Code: Build Your Own Website
item.description: Whether you have some or no coding experience, by the end of this course you'll have the skills required to build your own website. We’re doing something new here and implementing what’s known as a “flipped classroom”: You’ll complete online self-guided instruction modules at home and then come to the classes every other week to complete the interactive activities. This method allows the instructor to revisit concepts participants don’t understand, and everyone can collaborate. We request that you attend every class in order to get the most out of this course. Together, we’ll crack the HTML code using Treehouse, a new online resource.
item.date2: 201410271900Cracking the [HTML] Code: Build Your Own Website
item.otherinfo: Registration is required. A Skokie Library card is necessary to join this class.

item.title: Introduction to Podcasting
item.description: Have you ever wanted your own radio show? Podcasting makes it possible. In this hands-on class, you'll learn to record, edit, and share your voice on the Web. Class is taught on Apple computers.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Digital Craft Time: Movie Maker
item.description: Learn the basics of shooting and editing a movie. Producing something in this class counts toward the Maker Master Challenge.
item.otherinfo: For grades 3-5. Registration begins September 1.

item.title: Knit and Purl Drop In
item.description: Join us for a relaxing hour of knitting. Everyone is welcome, whether new to knitting or a veteran of the craft.
item.otherinfo: Please bring your own needles and yarn. We suggest bringing size #7 or #8 needles and play yarn like Red Heart Super Saver.

item.title: Digital Craft Time: Movie Maker
item.description: Learn the basics of shooting and editing a movie. Producing something in this class counts toward the Maker Master Challenge.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required. For grades 6-8.

item.title: Introduction to Computers and the Internet
item.description: This hands-on computer class is for beginners who would like to improve their basic computer skills. The instructors will start with how to turn on a computer and use a mouse, and end with how to go to a specific website using a Web browser.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required.

item.title: Community Conversation
item.description: Through open dialogue and guided by specific questions, participants will have the opportunity to share their aspirations and goals for the community of Skokie. Some of the knowledge gained from this conversation may inform a new library program, service, or partnership. Knowledge gained may also be shared with appropriate community organizations for them to address.
item.otherinfo: Registration is required. For more information call the Community Engagement Department.
